main event: Three yellowish lights were observed in Hugo, Colorado on December 2, 1956. The lights appeared as one object, graduated in size, and were stationary before gradually fading away over a five-minute period. The lights moved from east to west and had flashing lights present.
interesting points: The lights were estimated to be 25 feet apart from each other.
The top light faded first, followed by the middle light, and then the bottom light.
The report was received by telephone from the Colorado Springs Ground Observer Corps, and the Pilot Center was advised.
The conclusion of the sighting was inconclusive, with possibilities of the lights being a balloon, aircraft, or insufficient data for evaluation.
The report mentions the possibility of the lights being associated with an aircraft, but further investigative reports were needed to confirm.
result: possibilities of the sighting being a balloon, aircraft, or insufficient data for evaluation
sighted object: three yellowish lights appearing as one object
witnesses: Colorado Springs Ground Observer Corps, Pilot Center
